title: Cotton yield per harvested acre in the U.S. 2000 to 2019
summary: This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Yield per acre in pounds, with a total of 20 data points. The chart has 9 significant trends.
The longest trend is moderately negative which exists from 2007 to 2004.
On the contrary, the next significant trend is slightly negative which exists from 2019 to 2017.
Conversely, the next significant trend is extremely positive which exists from 2017 to 2015.
Correspondingly, the next significant trend is slightly positive which exists from 2015 to 2013.
Likewise, the next significant trend is moderately positive which exists from 2013 to 2011.
Similarly, the next significant trend is moderately positive which exists from 2011 to 2009.
Similarly, the next significant trend is slightly negative which exists from 2009 to 2007.
But, the next significant trend is extremely positive which exists from 2004 to 2002.
Likewise, the next significant trend is moderately negative which exists from 2002 to 2000.
gold: This statistic shows the total cotton yield per harvested acre in the U.S. from 2000 to 2019 . In 2019 , the total cotton yield per harvested acre amounted to approximately 817 pounds .
